description:
**Fix Overview**:

To address the secure boot security feature bypass vulnerability (CVE-2024-37970):

1. Identify your system's version and build number (refer to the list of affected build numbers).
2. Download and apply the relevant KB articles from the Microsoft Update Catalog:
   - For Windows 11 Version 23H2 and 22H2: [KB5040442](https://catalog.update.microsoft.com/Search.aspx?q=KB5040442)
   - For Windows 11 Version 21H2: [KB5040431](https://catalog.update.microsoft.com/Search.aspx?q=KB5040431)
   - For Windows 10 Versions 21H2 and 22H2: [KB5040427](https://catalog.update.microsoft.com/Search.aspx?q=KB5040427)
   - For Windows 10 for x64-based Systems: [KB5040448](https://catalog.update.microsoft.com/Search.aspx?q=KB5040448)
3. Restart your system after installation to ensure the changes take effect.

**Details**:
- This update addresses the stack-based buffer overflow which could allow bypassing secure boot security features.
- The updates are applicable to both x64 and 32-bit systems across various Windows versions.

**Preconditions**:
- Ensure the system is running one of the affected Windows versions.
- Backup critical data before proceeding with the update installation.
